original:
The Franciscan Friary in Dubrovnik was established by Mihoje Brajkov of Bar in 1360. Although much of the original structure was devastated by the earthquake of 1667, significant elements, such as the cloisters and the intricately carved church portal, have survived.

The lower cloister exhibits a blend of Romanesque and Gothic architectural styles. The capitals are designed in a Romanesque manner, yet the carvings depict lively creatur
sampled:
The Franciscan Friary in Dubrovnik was established by Mihoje Brajkov of Bar in 1360. Although much of the original structure was devastated by the earthquake of 1667, significant elements, such along the cloisters and the intricately carved church portal, have persisted.

The lower cloister exhibits a blend of Romanesque and Gothic architectural styles. The capitals are designed in a Romanesque manner, yet the carvings depict lively creatur
